name: Sanne Visser
note: A Blockchain tester Sanne is supportive and has shared some excellent Sketchnotes from Online Test Conf.

name: Simon Prior
note: Simon is is positive and selflessly giving to a fault! He is the reason that @testingpeers even have a podcast!

name: Dan Ashby
note: Dan is a podcaster and blogger who is quoted everywhere. His block on interviewing testers is a must read! Dan also happens to be the inspiration for Tester of The Day!

name: Huib Schoots
note: A Quality Coach and Agile Expert Huib is a giver of great, wonderfully blunt advice.

name: Shey
note: Chris Armstrongs's 'favorite #LeadershipThoughts giver'. Shey is so supportive and positive, it's infectious.

name: Russell Craxford
note: Russel is a Meetup host, giver of sage (pun intended) advice, understated hero in the testing world and conference volunteer

name: Bruce
note: Bruce is humble, witty, creative, addictive to get to know, smart as hell and super supportive.

name: Maaret Pyhäjärvi
note: Maaret has time for everyone, broke down boundaries for conference #CFP, blogs so insightfully.

name: Zeger Van Hese
note: Zeger is hands down the most engaging speaker Chris Armstrong has ever seen in person.

name: Melissa Benua
note: Melissa has worked HARD to make sure that testing is incorporated into the changes that we see in applications/sites/whatever is coming next.

name: Melissa Tondi
note: Melissa has been a powerhouse in the scene - it's grand to see her views on what a tester could be.

name: Bart knaack
note: Bart helps host a small remote meetup for everybody who misses the test community.

name: Wanda Hawkins-Kavanagh
note: Wanda celebrates those that are on the journey with her. Her posts on testing are rare, and that makes finding these gems of delight in understanding even more of a special thing.

name: Stu
note: Stu co-hosts @MoTBucks and his passion for quality shines through in all he does!

name: Emna Ayadi
note: Emna's presented an awesome talk at #tmatlc2020 on community of practices and gives so much to the community.

name: Beth Marshall
note: Beth has shown a passion for testing with great online talks. Beth is always happy to review and give feedback on ideas.

name: Maaike Brinkhof
note: Maaike's blog Journey into quality has an ongoing series: 10 years, 10 lessons.

name: Rafaela Azevedo
note: Check out Rafaela's excellent FREE course on Contract testing with PACT on the Test Automation University.

name: Marie Drake
note: Marie's excellent article on Debunking Accessibility Testing Myths covered on The Club by none other then Heather Reid and Tweeted out today by the Ministry of Testing. Well done Marie!

name: Chris McMahon
note: Thanks Chris, great insight into your Cucumber step about reverting from a destructive test.
